labels: level 1; out of scope; new record; jaguar; org-requested
title:
Add a new organization to ROR: 
 
International Platform on Mental Health
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: International Platform on Mental Health
Website: https://mhgc21.org/en/about
Link to publications: https://mhgc21.org/en/mhgc21/events/October-2021-Report/About-October-2021-Conference
Organization type: 
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: 
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization: MHGC21.ORG
Acronym/abbreviation: MHGC21.ORG
Related organizations: 
City: Kyiv
Country: Ukraine
Other information about this request: The International Platform on Mental Health “Mental Health: global challenges” (www.mhgc21.org ) is the platform for Social Initiatives, for dissemination of leading ideas and experience, for support of building academic and professional networks, developing future collaborations between researchers and professionals across the different regions of the world. The Platform is doing the attempt to rise the social awareness, to facilitate social changes, to support Governmental initiatives, to develop qualitative skills of professionals. The Platform helps researchers, social activists and all interested parties from all over the world to improve multidisciplinary aspects of Mental Health Care system
Since 2017 we are organizing annual International Conference “Mental Health; global challenges of XXI century”. We try to commute all main actors in the field of Mental Health. Thus, Governmental, International, Religious, Academic, Research, Educational and Civil Institutions, Volunteer Movements took part in the Conference activities. 
Among our Honorable Guests, Partners and Speakers were:    
•	World Federation of Mental Health (Dr. Ana de Sousa Baptista, Director of the Board and Chair of the Mental Health Policy Section of the World Federation of Mental Health)                                                           
•	WHO
•	International Medical Corps
•	Red Cross Society
•	Interdisciplinary Council on Development and Learning
•	Médecins Sans Frontières 
•	EMDR Europe Association
•	National Institute of Health (Italy)
•	Balkan Universities Association
•	Mental Health Reform, National Coalition for Mental Health in Ireland
The main Platform’s results are: social awareness-rising campaign, geographical diversification, research contributions, partnership building.
social awareness-rising campaign. The Platform organizes activities between these annual Conferences. Thus, in 2018 we organized several seminars and workshops in Ukraine. In January 2019 we organized National Round table meeting on rehabilitation of ex-combatants and their families. In May 2019 – International Public-Scientific Initiative” Community: health, human potential, socio-economic innovations”. For example, our audience for Event was more than 2 600 participants. In October 2020 – Mental Health Literacy Event (devoted to WMHD). Within this Event we organized activities in North (Chernigiv, Human Rights House), Central (Kyiv, National Academy of Management), South-West (Khmelnytsky, City Hospital), South-East (Zaporozhye, Caritas). Our audience (more than 600 persons) – family doctors, educators, social workers (persons who can “deliver” this knowledge to wide Ukrainian society)
geographical diversification. There were participants from Algeria, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Cyprus, Finland, Greece, Italy, Israel, Latvia, Lithuania, Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, South Africa, Taiwan, Ukraine, United Kingdom, USA on our Conference
research contributions. The MHGC Proceedings and Journal “Mental Health: global challenges” (ISSN 2612-2138) were established. The MHGC Proceedings is also placed in National Library of Ukraine (www.nbuv.gov.ua )
The International Journal “Mental Health: global challenges” (ISSN 2612-2138) (www.mhgcj.org ) is already indexed in DOAJI, ERIHPlus, Crossref, BASE, CORE, Index Copernicus, ResearchBib, … The Journal is also available on Publons (Clarivate Analytics), National Library of Australia, HINARY (WHO). The Journal considers with special attention the manuscripts which can be of interest for policy makers and practioners
partnership building. We are doing the attempt to establish cooperation regarding MHC globally. Among our participants were Governmental Institutions, Directors and Presidents, Vice-Directors, Vice-Rectors, Deans of the Faculties, Heads of the Departments, Professors and Specialists
comments:
nlundvick
08/02/2021, 18:19:19 | 08/02/2021, 18:19:19
comment_text: This is a Ukrainian organization established in 2017/2018 that organizes and publishes the proceedings for an annual conference on mental health. They also publish a peer reviewed open access journal. No affiliation use found. Organization seems to be run by one person, Dr. Viktor Vus. I don't think this organization is in scope, second reviewer may want to move to Needs Discussion. If adding, will also need to discuss metadata. Org name in the request was "International Platform on Mental Health", but the name throughout org's website is "Mental Health: Global Challenges of XXI Century."

---
KellyStathis
09/03/2021, 22:39:03 | 09/03/2021, 22:39:20
comment_text: I agree that this organization does not appear to be in scope, for the reasons described above. I checked that Dr. Viktor Vus uses a different affiliation when publishing, which is already in ROR (https://ror.org/01ezcv773) - see https://www.impactio.com/publication/2551944358. I am moving this to declined requests.

---

title:

Brown Dog Consulting
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Brown Dog Consulting
Website: www.browndogllc.com
Link to publications: https://unesdoc.unesco.org/ark:/48223/pf0000378061?posInSet=1&queryId=66d5f7f9-94e2-4253-9cc9-eba3d7b7ee8a
Organization type:

GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization: none
Acronym/abbreviation: BDC
Related organizations: Lotus Circle
City: Seattle
Country: United States
Other information about this request: I would like to register both Brown Dog Consulting LLC (a for-profit corporation) and Lotus Circle (a nonprofit corporation).  I am the founder of both organizations and am affiliated with the University of Washington in Seattle, WA as a Senior Fellow in the Disability Inclusive Development Initiative and, effective January 2022, Affiliate Assistant Professor in the Law, Societies and Justice Department.  Both BDC and LC are vehicles to bridge the gap between academic research and its practical applications.  I use both to facilitate contracting with external organizations such as UNESCO and Humanity & Inclusion for research particularly into the rights of persons with disabilities.  We are anticipating applying for grants from organizations like SVRI and others and expanding our research profile, for which a ROR ID would be helpful.  Many thanks in advance for your consideration.

---
mariagould
06/22/2021, 18:35:14 | 06/22/2021, 18:35:29
comment_text: Update (also posted in #93): 
Aragon Materials Science Institute (https://ror.org/031n2c920) maps to GRID ID grid.466773.7. The GRID record has been updated with a new name: Instituto de Nanociencia y Materiales de Aragón. Therefore, we may want to reconsider whether we should create a new record for the Institute of Nanoscience. 

---
mariagould
10/04/2021, 08:24:08 | 10/04/2021, 08:24:08
comment_text: Reviewing this one again with a final recommendation: We have an entry in ROR (https://ror.org/031n2c920) for Instituto de Nanociencia y Materiales de Aragón (INMA), an entity created in 2020 that fused the Institute of Research in Nanoscience of Aragon (INA) (no prior ROR ID) and Aragón Materials Science Institute (ICMA) (the name previously used in https://ror.org/031n2c920). The new institute name is being used as an affiliation in publications, e.g., https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cej.2020.126103.

My recommendation is that we add the prior names Institute of Research in Nanoscience of Aragon and Aragón Materials Science Institute as aliases to the existing record. 

Posting this comment in #93 as well. 

---
mariagould
10/05/2021, 18:21:08 | 10/05/2021, 18:21:08

arthurpsmith
12/06/2021, 20:37:47 | 12/06/2021, 20:37:47
comment_text: I agree with @nlundvick - this is a competition, not an organization, and it seems to be heavily associated with Texas A&M. I searched Google Scholar for  references to the full name ("Community Assessment of Community Annotation with Ontology") and it is referenced or acknowledged in about a dozen articles, but not used as an affiliation. Searching for the abbreviation CACAO brought up entirely unrelated papers so that wasn't helpful.  Anyway, I don't see this as being in scope for ROR.

---

comment_text: This is a private (for-profit?) training/educational institute. Link to publications does not include a list of publications. Rather, it includes one award and one certificate that were awarded to the institution. No publications found when searching Google Scholar and Web of Science. I concur with @arthurpsmith - this institution does not appear to be involved in research and therefore does not match criteria [2] for inclusion in ROR (https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates).

GRID ID:

Related organizations: 
City: Kyiv
Country: Ukraine
Year established: 2019
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To be integrated in a scholarly publishing system
Other information about this request: The International Platform on Mental Health “Mental Health: global challenges” (www.mhgc21.org ) is the platform for Social Initiatives, for dissemination of leading ideas and experience, for support of building academic and professional networks, developing future collaborations between researchers and professionals across the different regions of the world. The Platform is doing the attempt to rise the social awareness, to facilitate social changes, to support Governmental initiatives, to develop qualitative skills of professionals. The Platform helps researchers, social activists and all interested parties from all over the world to improve multidisciplinary aspects of Mental Health Care system
Since 2017 we are organizing annual International Conference “Mental Health; global challenges of XXI century”. We try to commute all main actors in the field of Mental Health. Thus, Governmental, International, Religious, Academic, Research, Educational and Civil Institutions, Volunteer Movements took part in the Conference activities. 
Among our Honorable Guests, Partners and Speakers were:    
•	World Federation of Mental Health (Dr. Ana de Sousa Baptista, Director of the Board and Chair of the Mental Health Policy Section of the World Federation of Mental Health)                                                           
•	WHO
•	International Medical Corps
•	Red Cross Society
•	Interdisciplinary Council on Development and Learning
•	Médecins Sans Frontières 
•	EMDR Europe Association
•	National Institute of Health (Italy)
•	Balkan Universities Association
•	Mental Health Reform, National Coalition for Mental Health in Ireland
The main Platform’s results are: social awareness-rising campaign, geographical diversification, research contributions, partnership building.
social awareness-rising campaign. The Platform organizes activities between these annual Conferences. Thus, in 2018 we organized several seminars and workshops in Ukraine. In January 2019 we organized National Round table meeting on rehabilitation of ex-combatants and their families. In May 2019 – International Public-Scientific Initiative” Community: health, human potential, socio-economic innovations”. For example, our audience for Event was more than 2 600 participants. In October 2020 – Mental Health Literacy Event (devoted to WMHD). Within this Event we organized activities in North (Chernigiv, Human Rights House), Central (Kyiv, National Academy of Management), South-West (Khmelnytsky, City Hospital), South-East (Zaporozhye, Caritas). Our audience (more than 600 persons) – family doctors, educators, social workers (persons who can “deliver” this knowledge to wide Ukrainian society)
geographical diversification. There were participants from Algeria, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Cyprus, Finland, Greece, Italy, Israel, Latvia, Lithuania, Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, South Africa, Taiwan, Ukraine, United Kingdom, USA on our Conference
research contributions. The MHGC Proceedings and Journal “Mental Health: global challenges” (ISSN 2612-2138) were established. The MHGC Proceedings is also placed in National Library of Ukraine (www.nbuv.gov.ua )
The International Journal “Mental Health: global challenges” (ISSN 2612-2138) (www.mhgcj.org ) is already indexed in DOAJI, ERIHPlus, Crossref, BASE, CORE, Index Copernicus, ResearchBib, … The Journal is also available on Publons (Clarivate Analytics), National Library of Australia, HINARY (WHO). The Journal considers with special attention the manuscripts which can be of interest for policy makers and practioners
partnership building. We are doing the attempt to establish cooperation regarding MHC globally. Among our participants were Governmental Institutions, Directors and Presidents, Vice-Directors, Vice-Rectors, Deans of the Faculties, Heads of the Departments, Professors and Specialists
comments:
mariagould
01/05/2022, 18:30:40 | 01/05/2022, 18:30:40
comment_text: This is a duplicate of #212, which we previously declined. 

---

body:

Name of organization: NASA
ROR ID: https://ror.org/00ryjtt64
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Other IDs for the organization, Organization type
Description of change: I am working for NASA's Science Mission Directorate on an information model for their new data discovery system (to discover data across all SMD divisions) which will be a graph/LOD based system.  I would like to use ROR metadata for information about NASA organizations and their types, etc.  However, in order to do that I need to have all of NASA (and lots of non-NASA) organizations that are archives to state in their ROR that they are an archive (no matter what else they are).  The SPDF is one of a very few facilities addressed in our first proof of concept use case, so its record would need to be updated to add the additional type.  

In addition, NASA may already have alternate ID's for each of these facilities, so the ability to add those would be very helpful...  They certainly do for this facility which has the id spase://SMWG/Repository/NASA/GSFC/SPDF

I do note that ideally we'd need the update sooner than 4 months from now...

01/20/2022, 20:10:15 | 01/20/2022, 20:10:15

Related organizations: https://ror.org/04v76ef78
City: Kiel
Country: Germany
Year established: 2020
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To be integrated in a scholarly publishing system
Other information about this request:
comments:
adambuttrick
01/13/2022, 19:51:07 | 01/13/2022, 19:54:54
comment_text: Not certain whether this sufficiently constitutes an independent, top-level entity. From the org's "Publishing" page:

"The services of Kiel University Publishing are available to all members and affiliates of Kiel University, as described in the constitution. This means that researchers from Kiel University must be involved in all publications, whether as authors or editors. Within the publication projects, they are therefore the main contact persons of the publishing team."

I can likewise find no affiliation usage for the press itself, which corresponds with the above (authors and editors would likely identify with Kiel University instead). In addition, Kiel University is already represented in ROR (https://ror.org/04v76ef78). We only otherwise seem to have 11 entities with a "university press" included in their title (https://ror.org/search?page=1&query=%22university%20press%22), but happy to hear anything else on precedent.

---
OAIWetz
01/19/2022, 16:35:44 | 01/19/2022, 16:35:44
comment_text: Dear ror team,
just added new record to wikidata
https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q110621719

best regards, Thorsten Wetzenstein

---
arthurpsmith
01/31/2022, 18:59:35 | 01/31/2022, 18:59:35
comment_text: Note their contact page says they are "c/o Universitätsbibliothek Kiel" - and the about page also mentions the publishing service is provided by the library. So not only is this clearly not an independent "top-level" organization, there's another layer between it and the university which we don't have in ROR either (German Wikipedia has an entry for the library at least: https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universitätsbibliothek_Kiel). So I'm afraid this is definitely out of ROR's current scope. If and when we support subunits of research organizations then this is a likely useful addition, but not right now.

---

Trout Lake Station
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Trout Lake Station
Website: https://limnology.wisc.edu/trout-lake-station-welcome/
Link to publications: e.g. see Google scholar profile of Tim Kratz: https://scholar-google-com.ezproxy.library.wisc.edu/citations?user=eB_hInEAAAAJ&hl=en&oi=sra
Organization type: Facility (A specialized facility where research takes place, such as a laboratory or telescope or dedicated research area)
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: 
ISNI ID: https://isni.org/isni/0000000404519715
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization: Trout Lake Research Station, UW Trout Lake Station
Acronym/abbreviation: TLS
Related organizations: University of Wisconsin Madison (parent), UW Center for Limnology (academic unit)
City: Boulder Junction
Country: United States
Year established: 1925
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To identify affiliations for datasets, To acknowledge a research facility, To be integrated in a scholarly publishing system
Other information about this request: Trout Lake Station is a core research facility of UW Madison but is located off the main campus in Boulder Junction, WI. It hosts users from >30 academic, agency and other units each year to conduct research and is the northern site for the NTL_LTER whose data is referenced and used by researchers for global comparative analyses of lakes.
comments:
adambuttrick
01/25/2022, 21:07:33 | 01/25/2022, 21:13:24
comment_text: Not certain whether this sufficiently constitutes a top-level entity as it is under the Center for Limnology at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. It's director appears to use the University of Wisconsin affiliation, (https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=-0lQw-wAAAAJ). Other research station entities in ROR appear to have a greater degree of independence. The North Temperate Lakes US Long-Term Ecological Research Network (https://lter.limnology.wisc.edu/), which they cite as supplying data for, also appears to be under the umbrella of the University of Wisconsin.

---
arthurpsmith
02/18/2022, 15:52:32 | 02/18/2022, 15:52:32
comment_text: I agree this is not a top-level research organization. At some point we should find a way to support these, but right now out of scope for ROR.

The ISNI entry they reference is also interesting, as it has "University of Wisconsin Madison Center for Limnology" as one of the names - but the request lists that as a parent. So things are a bit mixed up with respect to ISNI on this one anyway. On the Long-Term Ecological Research issue, we have at least one other request on this (#197, see also #442) so that would be a separate consideration.

Anyway, marking as declined and out of scope now.

---

sckott
02/07/2022, 17:51:19 | 02/07/2022, 17:51:19
comment_text: Thanks for creating this issue from the one I opened in #470 - I've never requested a change or addition to ROR - about how long does it take generally to get in to the ROR database? Weeks? Months? Longer?

---
adambuttrick
02/07/2022, 19:08:29 | 02/07/2022, 19:08:29
comment_text: @sckott We will plan to process the new record request in our next release (targeting Q1 of this year) and will be establishing a more regular schedule going forward. Please follow #470 to keep updated on its status.

---
adambuttrick
02/07/2022, 19:08:42 | 02/07/2022, 19:08:42
comment_text:  Closing this issue, as it is a dupe of #414.

---
sckott
02/07/2022, 19:55:26 | 02/07/2022, 19:55:26
comment_text: Thanks very much!

---
tyoungmarsh
03/03/2022, 09:38:52 | 03/03/2022, 09:38:52
comment_text: Hi Both,  can I ask why this request was declined?  I got no notification of any issues with the request and only discovered the updated status now.  I can see other tickets #470 #414.  Re address for new or merged university, Moylish, Limerick is to be used as HQ for research.  Please contact me if you have any questions regarding TUS.  Can I ask how long this process will take and which ticket number should I follow?  

---
adambuttrick
03/03/2022, 16:14:34 | 03/03/2022, 16:14:34
comment_text: @tyoungmarsh This request was closed as it is a duplicate request for #414. The request to merge the records itself has not been declined, just this duplicate instance of it. We allow only one issue to represent a specific request to prevent confusion and data errors. 

Please follow #414 for the merge and #470 for the new record request. The new record request has been approved and will be included in our next release (currently targeted for Q1 of this year). The deprecation and redirecting from old records will require development work, so unfortunately I don't have a timeline for its availability at present.

---
tyoungmarsh
03/03/2022, 16:25:56 | 03/03/2022, 16:25:56
comment_text: Hi @adambuttrick excellent, thank you so much.  I wrongly assumed work on creating/merging a new ROR would not commence without a request from an organisation, therefore I never checked to see if any tickets were already created.  Thanks again, and looking forward to seeing our new TUS ROR.

comment_text: Not certain this repository is sufficiently independent organization, as it is clearly under the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (https://ror.org/05h992307). I see very few similar records in ROR. The two that we do include (https://ror.org/00x6h5n95 ; https://ror.org/014trz974) are more distinctly independent entities. They would most likely use the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory ID for their data deposits and other contributors could likewise use their own ROR IDs.

labels: level 2; update record; jaguar; org-requested; merge records; redirect needed
title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
Public Health England (PHE) https://ror.org/00vbvha87
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Name of organization: Public Health England (PHE)
ROR ID: https://ror.org/00vbvha87
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record, Organization website, Other IDs for the organization
Description of change: Public Health England has been replaced by the UK Health Security Agency. Please see information related to this here
https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/public-health-england (information about replacement at the top of the page)
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/transforming-the-public-health-system/transforming-the-public-health-system-reforming-the-public-health-system-for-the-challenges-of-our-times (detailed information about the changes) 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UK_Health_Security_Agency
I am thinking it would be best to update/modify the existing PHE record because the majority of PHE functions are now part of UKHSA and the site locations of the main PHE sites are the same as previously.

Other information about this request: Please let me know if you need any further information we have recently for example updated the previous Ringgold ID for publishing with the new organisation name UK Health Security Agency ID 371011.
comments:
arthurpsmith
12/03/2021, 21:09:40 | 12/03/2021, 21:09:40
comment_text: There is a new wikidata ID also: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q104336949
It is still part of the Department of Health and Social Care.
There does NOT seem to be an ISNI for the new agency. I think it would be confusing to re-use this ROR id for the new one. I believe we should create a new ID for this since there are so many differences, and the previous organization was not entirely folded into the new one:
* Primary name: UK Health Security Agency
* Acronym: UKHSA
* Type: Government
* Established: 2020
* Country: United Kingdom
* Website: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/uk-health-security-agency
* Wikipedia link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UK_Health_Security_Agency
* Wikidata ID: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q104336949
* Parent organization: https://ror.org/03sbpja79


---
mariagould
01/05/2022, 23:26:57 | 01/05/2022, 23:27:20
comment_text: I received some additional information from the requesting organization that might help us come to a decision. The comments came from 3 different colleagues. The questions about handling deprecated/redirected IDs is something we don't have a solution for yet, but will be exploring this year. 

> In relation to your question on whether or not to update the existing record or create a new record for UKHSA please see comments below from staff here:
>  
> **Comment 1**
> I can’t see any disadvantages with a new entry for UKHSA. Obviously the PHE entry would need to indicate that PHE no longer exists. Would the PHE entry stay visible? If yes, then a suitable contact, presumably at UKHSA, should be supplied.
>  
> **Comment 2**
> Creating a new record for UKHSA should not be a disadvantage, but if a new record for UKHSA is created will it show that it was previously linked to PHE or are all the records on the ROR standalone records where no relationship/predecessor organisations are shown?
>  
> **Comment 3**
> I think the reason we were thinking to initially update/modify the existing record rather than create a new record was because we know of at least one current service that is using the ROR to identify organisations, and this is a journal checker tool: https://journalcheckertool.org/. Currently this journal checker tool is using PHE’s ROR ID, so if a new record is created for UKHSA it will mean we will have to contact this service to get them to change the organisation name/ROR ID to UKHSA. We are also unsure of any other services that are currently using PHE’s ROR ID that may need to be contacted if there is a new record created on the ROR for UKHSA. Although admittedly services currently using the PHE ROR ID might not be dynamically updating anyway, so even if the existing PHE ROR record was only updated/modified to show details of the new organisation these services may still need to be contacted to get them to manually update their information.

 

---
KellyStathis
01/25/2022, 23:51:35 | 01/25/2022, 23:51:35
comment_text: Weighing in here - to me, it's significant that the website says PHE has been replaced by UKHSA **and** the Office for Health Improvement and Disparities. If we modify PHE to UKHSA, we aren't representing the change accurately - and in cases where the previous ROR ID was used as an affiliation, staff who are now part of the OHID will be mislabeled as affiliated with UKHSA.

I support creating a new ROR ID for _both_ the new organizations - UKHSA and OHID - and relating these organizations back to PHE. This does mean that services that use the PHE ROR, like the journal checker tool, will need to make changes. 

Unfortunately, I think this is part of the messiness of government departments... we have similar cases in Canada that I have noticed in ROR (both federal and provincial level), which I haven't submitted yet. Ultimately, I would be interested to see ROR add predecessor/successor relationship types, for cases that are not a straightforward name change.

---
adambuttrick
02/16/2022, 23:36:46 | 02/16/2022, 23:37:55
comment_text: I agree with Kelly's assessment. We should create two records for the successor organizations, although we would have to determine what proper redirect for this case would be. I will flag this as an example in our development discussions, as well as the predecessor/successor relationship types as a potential change to the data model.

---
adambuttrick
05/03/2022, 14:44:25 | 05/03/2022, 14:44:25
comment_text: Closing as this has been separated into three corresponding issues.

---

comments:
adambuttrick
02/23/2022, 15:41:52 | 02/23/2022, 15:59:33
comment_text: Under the Horizon 2020 scheme, the ERA-NET funding program has been merged into a single instrument, with the goal of "topping up" funding for trans-European research across various domains. Full description of the instrument [here](https://ec.europa.eu/research/participants/docs/h2020-funding-guide/cross-cutting-issues/era-net_en.htm). We have a precedent in ROR, inherited from GRID, of a specific ERA-NET instrument from prior to their merging into a single instrument - ERA Plant Genomics https://ror.org/055pf8065.

I've added Brussels as a location because of the scheme originating with the European Commission, but please let me know if anyone thinks another location would be more appropriate. This specific request came in from a funding recipient looking to use ROR to acknowledge their funders.

---
adambuttrick
02/23/2022, 16:38:41 | 02/23/2022, 16:42:18
comment_text: @MSpenger Can you provide any insight on whether this funding scheme is in scope for ROR?

---
MSpenger
02/25/2022, 07:45:44 | 02/25/2022, 07:56:20
comment_text: @adambuttrick 

I think this item might need some extra discussion. Looking at the [Checklist for evaluating new organizations](https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/wiki/Curator-Evaluation-Workflow:-New-Records#checklist-for-evaluating-new-organizations), most criteria are not met. Also the type "funding scheme" does not exist as a type of organization in the [Guidance for evaluating common organization types](https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/wiki/Curator-Evaluation-Workflow:-New-Records#guidance-for-evaluating-common-organization-types). Technically, the ERC Research Council (https://ror.org/0472cxd90) is the organization behind the funding scheme ERA-Net Cofund.

"The main and compulsory activity of the ERA-NET Cofund under Horizon 2020 is the implementation of the co-funded joint call for proposals that leads to the funding of trans-national research and/or innovation projects (one co-funded call per Grant Agreement)." https://www.era-learn.eu/support-for-partnerships/cofunded-p2p/era-net-cofund 

A use case, where a funder ID might be needed, is the funding reference in the DataCite metadata schema:
```
<fundingReference>
<funderName>European Commission</funderName>
<funderIdentifier funderIdentifierType="Crossref Funder ID">https://doi.org/10.13039/501100000780</funderIdentifier>
<awardNumber awardURI="https://cordis.europa.eu/project/rcn/100603_en.html">284382</awardNumber>
<awardTitle>
Institutionalizing global genetic-resource commons. Global Strategies for accessing and using essential public knowledge assets in the life sciences
</awardTitle>
</fundingReference>
```

However, "ERA-Net Cofund" cannot be found in either ISNI or Crossref Funder Registry.

And regarding the entry mentioned in the initial post, the "Year established" shows 9999. Is this used as a placeholder?

---
adambuttrick
05/03/2022, 15:39:42 | 05/03/2022, 15:39:42
comment_text: Out of scope per discussion on 2022/05/03. Should use ERC ID for referencing this funding.

---

04/28/2022, 20:22:01 | 04/28/2022, 20:22:01
comment_text: This is a legacy issue from early days of the curation pilot in 2020 and we were not able to make a clear determination on scope at the time. I am reinstating it for review now. @MSpenger I believe you initially created this request, so can you confirm whether the request is still valid, and if so, how we would evaluate it given our current criteria and workflows?

comments:
arthurpsmith
05/03/2021, 21:00:11 | 05/03/2021, 21:00:11
comment_text: Hmm, this is seems to be a new funding program, part of the Australian "National Environmental Science Program" (NESP), under the Australian government "Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment", ROR https://ror.org/030c92375. Neither NESP nor this portion of it seem to have funder ID's. However NESP does have an ISNI id: https://isni.org/isni/0000000494148945 
I don't see any sign of this recovery hub being used as an affiliation. The publications they list are from researchers at other universities in Australia, generally.

If we add something for this to ROR I think we ought to just add NESP which seems to be the higher-level funding organization and is referenced in several places on this recovery hub website. But maybe the existing Australian AWE department is enough?

---
KellyStathis
07/07/2021, 22:22:33 | 07/07/2021, 22:22:33
comment_text: This one is tricky. I think it is used as an affiliation (for example, in https://www.publish.csiro.au/pc/Fulltext/PC19036?subscribe=false), but it is listed alongside Charles Darwin University in this publication, one of the Hub's partner universities (https://www.environment.gov.au/science/nesp/hub-threatened-species-recovery). It appears that all researchers affiliated with the Hub have another research organization as their primary appointment.

I am not sure if adding NESP addresses the issue; to me, it seems less accurate to say that these researchers are affiliated with NESP broadly, than to say they are affiliated with their specific research Hub. The six Hubs seem to function independently from each other (separate websites, etc), although each is accountable to NESP.

Another factor is that this project does not appear to be premised on long-term stability. According to this page, this Hub will not continue to exist past 2021 - it is part of Phase 1 of the NESP: http://www.environment.gov.au/science/nesp/phase-1. There are different Hubs for Phase 2: http://www.environment.gov.au/science/nesp/about.

---
adambuttrick
05/23/2022, 16:50:09 | 05/23/2022, 16:50:09
comment_text: Phase one hubs would be out of scope, as they ceased in 2021.

---

09/09/2021, 15:42:12 | 09/09/2021, 15:42:12
comment_text: I removed the "Crossref Funder ID" as that was not a Crossref Funder ID, just a copy of the publication DOI. They appear to be a small publisher with one journal "African Journal of Political Sciences" from Algeria which seems to publish in Arabic? Not to be confused with "African Journal of Political Science" from South Africa which publishes in English and French. Their website is a mess - at least when I opened it with Chrome most of the pages were blank or almost full of advertising. The journal pages also had ads but they appear to be legitimate political science research papers. They've been around since 2012, or at least that is when the first issue of the journal came out.

So this is a scope question - are we adding small publishers like this one, or not? I'd be inclined to say no. Willing to hear a second opinion though.

The African Journal of Political Sciences is supposed to be OA, but I could access full-text to any of the articles in the publication. There was just metadata and a download button that I was a bit worried about. 

I'm not sure that it makes sense to assign a ROR at this point.

arthurpsmith
02/18/2022, 15:43:43 | 02/18/2022, 15:43:43
comment_text: I'm not very impressed with their website - most of the things you click on do not seem to provide any information (the FAQ, the lists of members, in particular - tried Safari and Chrome). However, it does appear to have been used as an affiliation in publications by more than one or two distinct researchers. Is it really a research organization in the sense that we define it? I guess we do have a precedent as mentioned. So while this might be a borderline case, I do think it should have a ROR id.

05/23/2022, 23:34:22 | 05/23/2022, 23:34:22

adambuttrick
01/26/2022, 16:14:03 | 01/26/2022, 16:15:20
comment_text: Not certain whether this is a sufficiently established organization. It appears to be a yearly conference held in the Bahamas with the intent of establishing a research institute there. From the organization's description of itself on the website: "This is a proposal to create a center for theoretical research and training of advanced students and postdoctoral scientists at a location on Long Island, Bahamas." Very limited publication usage as well, generally as a secondary affiliation, e.g.: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1140%2Fepjc%2Fs10052-021-09646-z

01/27/2022, 18:45:59 | 01/27/2022, 18:45:59
comment_text: I've heard of this before, it's been around for a while as a conference series (since 2016). But I think it's a one-person project - Guendelman is the one who's been using it as an affiliation, and from Google Scholar it's on 4 or 5 papers at most. If it really does create an institute as proposed then we can add to ROR then; we can move it to "on hold" for now, but I think it's likely to remain out of scope for at least a few more years.

---
adambuttrick
05/23/2022, 23:39:01 | 05/23/2022, 23:39:01
comment_text: Declining this as out of scope, as it is both a one-person organization and has no new affiliation usage. Should the institute ever be built, they can resubmit.

title: Add a new organization to ROR: Helmholtz Open Science Office
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Helmholtz Open Science Office
Website: https://os.helmholtz.de/
Link to publications: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.2575346; https://doi.org/10.1177/0963662516678514; https://doi.org/10.1515/9783110494068; https://doi.org/10.5282/o-bib/2017H2S35-55; https://doi.org/10.2312/lis.17.01; https://doi.org/10.5282/o-bib/2017H1S151-169
Organization type: Other
Wikipedia page:
Wikidata ID:
ISNI ID:
GRID ID:
Crossref Funder ID:
Other names for the organization: 
Acronym/abbreviation:
Related organizations: https://ror.org/0281dp749 (parent)
City: Potsdam
Country: Germany
Year established: 2005
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? 
Other information about this request: The Helmholtz Open Science Office is an independent department of the Helmholtz Assoziation to raise awareness for open science topics in the whole Helmholtz community and to promote open scholarly communication and publishing practices for all researchers.
comments:
mariagould
03/18/2022, 18:48:42 | 03/18/2022, 18:48:42
comment_text: This is a legacy request submitted by the organization in 2020. The organization decided to hold the request until ROR had the ability to link related organizations. I am reinstating the request so that we can review it for inclusion in a future release. 

This is an independent entity that is also part of the Helmholtz Association (https://ror.org/0281dp749). It is involved in publishing research and supporting researchers. As far as I can tell, publications associated with the office tend to use the main affiliation for the Helmholtz Association, and related IDs are at the association level as well. 

We should consider whether the current representation at the association level is sufficient, or whether a new record should be created to identify the open science office. 

---
arthurpsmith
05/17/2022, 18:48:32 | 05/17/2022, 18:48:32
comment_text: This is not listed as one of the 18 Hemlholtz centers - https://www.helmholtz.de/ueber-uns/helmholtz-zentren/ - rather it is mentioned under their "values" - https://www.helmholtz.de/ueber-uns/unsere-werte/open-science/ - I think at the least this office is not really considered independent of the central association as are the research centers. I did find one use of the office explicitly as an affiliation, but generally their staff seem to be happy to just list "Helmholtz Association" as the affiliation. My recommendation is not to create a new ROR id for this office, at least until/unless we are ready to add university departments etc which I would consider comparable or more justified than this.

---
adambuttrick
06/07/2022, 02:14:35 | 06/07/2022, 02:14:35
comment_text: Agree with Arthur's assessment. Declining as out-of-scope.

---

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
JDSU (United States) https://ror.org/01a5v8x09
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Update record:
Name of organization: JDSU (United States)
ROR ID: https://ror.org/01a5v8x09
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Organization website
Description of change: This corporate has change names. It and its children need to be updated to VIAVI, www.viavisolutions.com
comments:
adambuttrick
02/13/2022, 19:19:20 | 02/13/2022, 19:26:48
comment_text: Not certain we should process this as a simple name change. According to Wikipedia, the company was split into two different entities in 2015:

"In August 2015, JDSU split into two different companies: [Viavi Solutions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viavi_Solutions) and [Lumentum Holdings](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lumentum_Holdings&action=edit&redlink=1)[](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JDSU#cite_note-3)."

So, we should probably process this as a new record and deprecation request, as well as possible deprecating the non-US records. While they list foreign offices on their site, it's not clear to me that these still constitute independent, top-level entities. The "Office Locations" section of their site list a single corporate headquarters and the sales, manufacturing, and research and development facilities.

---
arthurpsmith
05/19/2022, 17:15:35 | 05/19/2022, 17:15:35
comment_text: I agree with Adam here, this should be deprecated and not updated to the new name; in fact we already have a ROR entry for Viavi Solutions - https://ror.org/059a9e323 (we could update that with Wikidata ID Q28222763, English Wikipedia page https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viavi_Solutions). I'm not sure how you want to proceed - I guess I'll move this into "Needs discussion" but I don't know that we need to do much here other than deprecate at least the US entry for JDSU (and redirect to the other ID when possible).

---
adambuttrick
06/07/2022, 02:17:34 | 06/07/2022, 02:17:34
comment_text: I'm going to say this is addressed solely by the deprecation.

---

Country: The Netherlands
Geonames ID: 2757345
Year established: 2019
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To identify affiliations for datasets, To acknowledge research funders, To acknowledge a research facility, To be integrated in a scholarly publishing system

Other information about this request: Welcome to TU Delft OPEN, the open access publisher of Delft University of Technology (TU Delft). We publish high-standard, peer-reviewed content authored or edited by academics of TU Delft, often in collaboration. TU Delft OPEN predominantly publishes books, journals, and textbooks, but, as an open access publisher, we seek to expand and include other types of scholarly content. We also provide support, consultancy and services to TU Delft scholars in their journey towards academic and societal visibility, and impact.
comments:
adambuttrick
03/14/2022, 16:51:05 | 03/14/2022, 16:51:05
comment_text: TU Delft's university press. Publishes numerous open access books and journals, including co-publications with other universities and research institutes (e.g. [International Journal of Water Governance](https://journals.open.tudelft.nl/ijwg)). More examples [here](https://www.tudelft.nl/en/library/current-topics/open-publishing). While university presses normally require independent affiliation usage, the scope of their activities and editorial involvement from outside researchers puts them closer to the precedents like https://ror.org/03jsdjx34 and https://ror.org/006v7bf86. Believe they are in scope for ROR.

---
arthurpsmith
05/17/2022, 17:06:24 | 05/17/2022, 17:06:24
comment_text: It seems to me this is too closely tied to TU Delft to qualify for a separate ROR id. Cambridge University Press has its own website, has been around almost 500 years, has a major presence in many areas of publishing, has thousands of employees around the world - and has a pretty substantive wikipedia page about itself. I don't think this university press is anywhere close to comparable.

---
adambuttrick
06/07/2022, 16:51:36 | 06/07/2022, 16:51:36
comment_text: Out of scope, per discussion on June 7th, 2022. Should use broader university affiliation.

comments:
adambuttrick
04/01/2022, 04:12:18 | 04/01/2022, 04:12:18
comment_text: Educational institute in the Czech Republic. Publishes journal _International Journal of Public Administration, Management and Economic Development_. Hosts academic conferences. Limited publication affiliation usage, but otherwise appears in scope for ROR.

Publication affiliation usage: https://bibliotekanauki.pl/articles/438648 ; 

---
arthurpsmith
05/18/2022, 15:39:02 | 05/18/2022, 15:39:02
comment_text: Hi - there seems to be a bit of confusion here.
Jagiellonian College in Toruń is in Toruń, Poland, and its website is https://kj.edu.pl/
That is the entity with Wikipedia page https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jagiellonian_College and WIkidata ID Q9360262
There is also a Polish wikipedia page for it here: https://pl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kolegium_Jagiello%C5%84skie_%E2%80%93_Toru%C5%84ska_Szko%C5%82a_Wy%C5%BCsza
It was established in 2003. We don't seem to have a ROR id for it, so that would be good to add.

However, the requested entity here is something different - it appears to be a particular faculty of this college that is located in the Czech Republic. The English website (http://www.fves.eu/en/index.html) gives it the full name of "Faculty of Administration and Economic Studies in Uherské Hradiště Jagiellonian College in Toruń".

The affiliation usage case that Adam found doesn't mention whether it's the Polish or Czech locations, so I'm not sure if it supports having a separate identifier for the Czech faculty. However, given previous GRID practices that created separate entities for subsidiaries in a different country I think a ROR id for the Czech entity is also justified here. But we should take some care with the metadata so that we are clearly distinguishing them.

---
adambuttrick
05/18/2022, 15:53:17 | 05/18/2022, 15:54:32
comment_text: @arthurpsmith Good catch. I'm going to create a request for the main campus and keep this as a separate issue to discuss whether the Czech institute is in scope as a distinct entity. Since the page lists it as "part of the Jagiellonian University in Toruń, Poland," there needs to be sussing out of whether any of the affiliation usage references the Czech vs Polish departments.

---
adambuttrick
06/22/2022, 20:34:54 | 06/22/2022, 20:34:54
comment_text: Per discussion with @mariagould and curation team, we created a record for just the main institution in Poland in release v1.1. Declining this request.

---
adambuttrick
07/13/2022, 21:58:01 | 07/13/2022, 21:58:01
comment_text: The metadata for these journals is indexed under the Crossref member ID for the parent organization:

https://api.crossref.org/works/10.24968/2473-912X.3.1.2

Crossref would assign https://ror.org/012dg8a96 to this record, so I believe the library as a separate entity is out of scope.

title:
Split an existing ROR record into two or more records: 
 
Plant Gene Expression Centerhttps://ror.org/03rafms67
body:
Summary of request: Split an existing ROR record into two or more records

Update record:
Name of organization: 
ROR ID: 
Which part of the record needs to be changed? 
Description of change: 

Merge/split/deprecate records:
Organizations affected by this change:Plant Gene Expression Center
ROR ID(s) of organization(s) affected by this change: https://ror.org/03rafms67
How should the record(s) be changed? 2 Options - There is a need to either update the "Parent Organization" relationship of this record and add another URL to this record in order to seperate the difference in federal funding vs state funding for the "Plant Gene Expression Centers". The PGEC is a collaboration of the Agricultural Research Service of the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) and the Plant & Microbial Biology Department of the University of California, Berkeley (ECB). For the CURRENT RECORD (https://ror.org/03rafms67) the URL assigned to this record is http://pgec.berkeley.edu/ (which references the correct location of the center for the Plant Gene Expression Center - University of California, Berkley). However, the "Parent Organization" (which may need a new record to differentiate another layer of hierarchy) as part of the Pacific West Area (Plant Gene Expression Center, USDA-ARS, Albany, CA 94710, USA. Correct referencing homepage: https://www.ars.usda.gov/pacific-west-area/albany-ca/pgec/ (Plant Gene Expression Center - Albany - USDA ARS).
comments:
adambuttrick
08/12/2022, 17:44:18 | 08/12/2022, 17:44:18
comment_text: The current/UC Berkeley link in ROR references both the joint status/USDA funding and the record has the location as being in Albany, CA. In addition, both [UC Berkley](https://ror.org/01an7q238) and the [USDA Agricultural Research Service - Pacific West Area](https://ror.org/03rafms67) are already listed as parent organization for this record, so I'm not certain what we would need to change here. We could add an additional link for the USDA ARS site, as technically this is a repeating field, but it would seem that funding differentiation should happen at the level of the parents.

---
mariagould
08/26/2022, 02:03:00 | 08/26/2022, 02:03:00
comment_text: I agree that it is not necessary to create another parent record. I support adding the second URL for clarity and comprehensiveness and to aid discovery. 

---
adambuttrick
09/20/2022, 18:06:09 | 09/20/2022, 18:06:09
comment_text: Requester has indicated second link is not needed.

comment_text: Research institute associated with Chinese petroleum company, Daqing Oilfield of CNPC. More extensive affiliation usage exists for the parent company using the English form "Daqing Oilfield Company" (e.g. : https://doi.org/10.1306/08031817416; https://doi.org/10.1016/j.marpetgeo.2008.01.008; https://doi.org/10.1016/j.bios.2015.06.020; https://doi.org/10.1016/j.earscirev.2016.05.004; https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1365-2117.2009.00445.x; https://doi.org/10.2118/121460-pa). 

Despite solid affiliation usage, I'm having difficulty verifying that this research institute exists separately from the company itself. Would appreciate other's thoughts here, although whatever the determination, we would still likely need to create the parent record.

Publication affiliation usage: https://doi.org/10.7623/syxb201501011; https://doi.org/10.1360/zd-2011-41-7-1000; https://doi.org/10.2118/186276-MS; https://doi.org/10.2118/200443-MS
; http://en.cnki.com.cn/Article_en/CJFDTOTAL-SYHH201103025.htm

---

10/26/2022, 19:14:30 | 10/26/2022, 19:14:30
comment_text: Per requestor comment on #1454, the research institute is a sub-entity of the company. Closing this and creating a ROR ID for the parent entity.

labels: level 1; out of scope; new record; lion
title: Add a new organization to ROR: Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization to be added | Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata

Organization website | https://openscholarlymetadata.org/

Briefly explain why you are requesting a ROR ID for this organization and how the ROR ID will be used. | Scholarly infrastructures such as CDL, Crossref and DataCite all have RORs. Inspired by PIDapalooza 2021, following these examples, and having just requested a ROR for OpenCitations, I request a ROR for OpenCitations' host institution The Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata.

Provide DOI(s) or links for research associated with this organization, such as published articles that include the organization's name as an affiliation. If DOIs or links are not available, describe the research-related activities of this organization. | https://doi.org/10.1162/qss_a_00023

Other relevant metadata about the organization (e.g., name variants in other languages, related records in ROR, links to external records such as Wikidata) | https://github.com/openscholarlymetadata, https://workshop-oc.github.io/
comments:
arthurpsmith
05/05/2021, 18:42:38 | 05/05/2021, 18:42:38
comment_text: While this has an independent URL, the example affiliation listings look like "Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata, Department of Classical Philology and Italian Studies, University of Bologna", which clearly suggests this is part of the University of Bologna. As does the "About" page on the website. I think this is not a top-level organization and so does not qualify for its own ROR id.

---
carlyrobinson
07/12/2021, 15:17:37 | 07/12/2021, 15:17:37
comment_text: May be associated with two separate organizations - OpenCitations (which we've already approved to add to ROR) and  University of Bologna within the Department of Classical Philology and Italian Studies. Used as an affiliation, but under this department at University of Bologna. Not sure if it should have separate ROR.

---
mariagould
07/15/2021, 17:56:41 | 07/15/2021, 17:57:08
comment_text: Some additional comments from the original request that may shed light on the need for a new ROR ID and the center's relationship to OpenCitations:

> The reason that we need two RORs, one for OpenCitations and one for the Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata is as follows:

> OpenCitations is distinct from and pre-existed the Research Centre, having grown to become a valuable independent infrastructure from a small beginning as a research project in my lab.

> The Research Centre was created specifically for two purposes: (a) to provide an institutional affiliation, a legal financial centre, and a formal administrative 'home' for OpenCitations, and (b) to permit academic activities affiliated with OpenCitations, such as being the academic home for graduate students of the University of Bologna working on projects involving open citations.  The Research Centre is formally a part of the University of Bologna in a way that OpenCitations is not.

> In the medium-term future, OpenCitations may 'spin out' to become a non-profit foundation /association/Stiftung under direct governance by the wider academic community and other stakeholders, that is administratively and financially independent from the University of Bologna.  In that case, OpenCitations will continue with its stated mission of providing open bibliographic metadata and citations, and the Research Centre will continue as an integral part of the University of Bologna in its academic roles with respect to OpenCitations, and will probably by then also have expanded its activities to include other types of metadata-oriented research work, but it will no longer be administratively and financially responsible for OpenCitations.

> For these reasons of distinctiveness, it would be sensible if OpenCitations and the Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata were issued separate RORs from the start, rather than trying to disentangle them at some point down the line.  That was the basis of my thinking when I wrote.

---
mariagould
09/07/2021, 15:44:39 | 09/07/2021, 15:44:39
comment_text: We believe this should be reviewed at a later point to determine if there is a use case for a separate ROR ID for this center. 

---
adambuttrick
05/23/2022, 16:57:32 | 05/23/2022, 16:58:51
comment_text: Affiliation usage in 2022 continues to be a leading affiliation for the University of Bologna:

https://arxiv.org/ftp/arxiv/papers/2205/2205.06764.pdf

Since this is essentially a request to create a new ROR ID contingent on a hypothetical restructuring of the organizations, I'd advise we decline this request. They can resubmit in the event any of what they described in the above actually occurs.



---
adambuttrick
11/01/2022, 19:18:29 | 11/01/2022, 19:18:29
comment_text: Situation is unchanged. Declining as out of scope.

---

comments:
adambuttrick
02/23/2022, 16:35:24 | 02/23/2022, 16:36:23
comment_text: Biotechnology company whose primary focus is a novel Alzheimer's therapeutic. Principals are all well-credentialed with solid publication history (https://phanesbiotech.com/publications/), but do not appear to use Phanes Biotech as their primary affiliation. That being said, is clearly involved with drug development and research and we have many similar companies in ROR (e.g. https://ror.org/02eb03q95 ; https://ror.org/043f79m81).

---
arthurpsmith
04/22/2022, 12:47:32 | 04/22/2022, 12:47:32
comment_text: Hmm, I think we should wait on this one. There's a very similarly named company that appears to be larger and more well-established, "Phanes Therapeutics" - https://www.phanesthera.com/ (from San Diego, established 2016) - for which we do not have a ROR ID, and it seems likely if we create one for this company without creating one for the other that could lead to some confusion. I can't find any relationship between the two, and this company is not listed for example in Crunchbase or mentioned in any news reports I could find.

The publications listed on their "publications" page are all from 2017 or earlier as far as I could see, which predates the company formation (so it wouldn't have been used as an affiliation). I recommend we put this on hold until we see they are actually publishing or funding research with this affiliation.

---
adambuttrick
05/03/2022, 15:52:13 | 05/03/2022, 15:52:13
comment_text: Moving to hold for later to see if further evidence of affiliation usage surfaces.

---
adambuttrick
11/01/2022, 19:29:37 | 11/01/2022, 19:29:37
comment_text: Still no examples of affiliation usage, so declining as out of scope. May resubmit when affiliation usage can be demonstrated.

---

comments:
adambuttrick
11/09/2022, 19:17:09 | 11/09/2022, 19:17:09
comment_text: I'm not certain that GRIIDC constitutes a top-level entity in ROR's sense of the term. They appear to be a data project arising from the Harte Research Institute for Gulf of Mexico Studies at Texas A&M University – Corpus Christi, as well as part of a now defunct ([by their own description](https://gulfresearchinitiative.org/)) ten-year program called the, "Gulf of Mexico Research Initiative." They do [publish datasets](https://data.gulfresearchinitiative.org/dataset-landing), but I'm not sure who would actually be considered the publisher in this case. @KellyStathis Any similar cases at DataCite that might help clarify here?

KellyStathis
11/09/2022, 22:34:05 | 11/09/2022, 22:34:05
comment_text: @adambuttrick Looks like they are mainly using Harte Research Institute as publisher: https://api.datacite.org/dois?client-id=tdl.griidc. Does this help?

---

11/09/2022, 22:46:53 | 11/09/2022, 22:46:53
comment_text: @KellyStathis It does! Thank you! Harte Research Institute does not exist in ROR, so I will look at adding.

11/22/2022, 20:53:11 | 11/22/2022, 20:53:11

10/31/2022, 16:11:22 | 10/31/2022, 16:11:22

---
cmf2022
10/31/2022, 20:44:50 | 10/31/2022, 20:44:50
comment_text: Thanks for the response to our request, However we would like to provide some more useful information.  
1. Cure Medical Facility is engaged in community welfare activities, please find the link
https://www.thesharedcare.org/who-we-are/

2. Below link will direct you to another publication
https://www.ijogr.com/wp-content/uploads/Volume/COVID%2019/Analysis%20of%20COVID-19%20Pandemic%20Through%20Narrative%20Literature%20Review.pdf

3. The aim of our request is mainly to allow our researchers to publish their work in high impact factor journals. 

---
adambuttrick
10/31/2022, 20:53:14 | 10/31/2022, 20:53:14
comment_text: @cmf2022 Thank you for this additional context. With these details, I think is fine to add.

---
cmf2022
11/02/2022, 19:02:17 | 11/02/2022, 19:02:17
comment_text: Thanks for the response.
How long will it take to reflect in the database?

---
adambuttrick
11/02/2022, 19:54:42 | 11/02/2022, 19:54:42
comment_text: @cmf2022 All new record requests require a secondary approval by a member of the curation team. Assuming this approval, we should be able to get this record added by the end of this month.

---
arthurpsmith
11/18/2022, 21:14:37 | 11/18/2022, 21:14:37
comment_text: I think this is a single-person medical practice, and so out of scope. 

---
cmf2022
11/24/2022, 11:46:44 | 11/24/2022, 11:46:44
comment_text: Cure Medical Facility is an OBGYN based setup in its entirety. Our Team is dedicated to collecting OBGYN-based data crucial for research work. Please allow us to be enlisted, as it's one of the requirement for publication(s) in various research journals.

---
amandafrench
11/24/2022, 15:51:38 | 11/24/2022, 15:51:38
comment_text: @cmf2022 Can you tell us which publication is requiring a ROR ID? We strongly recommend against this practice, and we have also found that many authors have the mistaken impression that a ROR ID is required by a publication when it is not. Try contacting someone at the journal or publishing organization if you're unsure. 

---
cmf2022
11/24/2022, 18:06:30 | 11/24/2022, 18:06:30
comment_text: It is required for the Article Submission in Hindawi Portal. Attached here is the Proof.
![PHOTO-2022-10-30-00-30-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/117011067/203845450-da1a1d00-9396-4626-8120-27eb4142b0d8.jpg)


---
adambuttrick
11/29/2022, 17:30:34 | 11/29/2022, 17:30:34
comment_text: @cmf2022 We've confirmed with Hindawi that no papers are being held up for lack of a ROR ID. If you respond via their platform and indicate that a ROR ID is not needed, the submission will proceed normally. We're working with Hindawi to update this messaging so that this is more clear. Apologies for the confusion. ROR is not able to add organizations where research outputs are associated with a only one person. 

---

comment_text: Hi @adambuttrick, I was the requester for this record. Would be happy to answer any questions. Also, if it's helpful, I can create a wikidata entry for this company as well.

---
adambuttrick
11/30/2022, 03:01:15 | 11/30/2022, 03:01:15
comment_text: Thank you, @cthoyt. Are there others using the affiliation beside the principal, Nico Matentzoglu? I could find no instances of affiliations aside from their usage. One-person organizations are unfortunately not in scope for ROR.

---
cthoyt
11/30/2022, 08:05:39 | 11/30/2022, 08:05:39
comment_text: Correct, this is a one person organization. However, I don't recall any of the notes on what's in scope mentioning that one-person organizations were out of scope. Perhaps some of that communication could be updated. Thank you for the consideration!

---
adambuttrick
11/30/2022, 17:49:22 | 11/30/2022, 17:49:22
comment_text: @cthoyt We mention this in our [Criteria for inclusion in ROR](https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates#criteria-for-inclusion-in-ror), "is or will be used as an affiliation in published research outputs by multiple people," but I will see about making this more explicit in other parts of our documentation. Apologies for the confusion!

---
cthoyt
11/30/2022, 17:54:59 | 11/30/2022, 17:54:59
comment_text: I had to read the thing you linked two more times before I understood what I meant - so great to see that this will lead to improvement :) 

---

11/30/2022, 17:56:31 | 11/30/2022, 17:56:31
comment_text: I would add that this is also addressed in the documentation curators use to evaluate new organization requests ([see the checklist](https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/wiki/Curator-Evaluation-Workflow:-New-Records#checklist-for-evaluating-new-organizations)) but I agree the criteria could be made more explicit. Thanks for the feedback!

University of Wisconsin–Sheboygan
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: University of Wisconsin–Sheboygan
Website: https://www.uwgb.edu/sheboygan/
Link to publications: https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1465-7287.2007.000   https://typeset.io/institutions/university-of-wisconsin-sheboygan-205wqdp849.x  
Organization type: Education (A university or similar institution involved in providing education and educating/employing researchers)
Wikipedia page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Wisconsin%E2%80%93Green_Bay,_Sheboygan_Campus
Wikidata ID: Q7896665
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: grid.447684.d
Crossref Funder ID: 
Aliases: none
Labels:
Acronym/abbreviation:
Related organizations: https://ror.org/05hbexn54 (parent)
City: Sheboygan, Wisconsin
Country: United States
Geonames ID:
Year established: 1933
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications

Other information about this request: This organization has a GRID, but does not have a corresponding ROR.  Hoping it can be created.  Thank you!
comments:
adambuttrick
12/01/2022, 23:31:26 | 12/01/2022, 23:31:57
comment_text: Campus of https://ror.org/05hbexn54 that GRID removed. Despite affiliation usage under this name ( https://doi.org/10.1016/j.rie.2010.05.001; https://doi.org/10.1088/0004-6256/150/5/159; https://doi.org/10.1017/s1755048316000808; https://doi.org/10.1300/j264v12n02_07; https://doi.org/10.1007/s11079-009-9127-7; https://doi.org/10.1016/j.najef.2010.09.002; https://doi.org/10.1080/13642987.2015.1082846; https://doi.org/10.1080/09638199.2010.491160; https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1465-7287.2007.00049.x; https://doi.org/10.1207/s15328023top1302_7), I'm not sure we should add back as such. The hierarchy here is University of Wisconsin-Green Bay > Sheboygan campus, so we would probably need to render as such, but there does not appear to be official usage of this form. Whether University of Wisconsin-Green Bay as an entity is separate from or comprised by the individual campuses is also ambiguous.

---
mariagould
12/11/2022, 21:12:04 | 12/11/2022, 21:13:02
comment_text: I agree that we should not restore this withdrawn record. This is a different type of campus situation than, e.g., campuses of the University of California. 

University of Wisconsin-Green Bay is the overarching entity and one of the four "campuses" (locations) comprising the university. Faculty and staff associated with the Sheboygan location do not have separate email addresses or titles specific to Sheboygan, as seen here: https://www.uwgb.edu/directory/sheboygan/. Given that we do not create records for multiple locations associated with a university (e.g., the Mission Bay campus of UCSF), I agree it is fine to keep the record withdrawn and recommend that the primary ID https://ror.org/05hbexn54 be used to reference the affiliation. 



---

---
mariagould
01/10/2023, 23:22:43 | 01/10/2023, 23:27:22
comment_text: I believe this is related to #1973 and concerns the record for Hospital Sabadell (https://ror.org/02v39xy13). I recommend that we deactivate the record for Hospital Sabadell (https://ror.org/02v39xy13). Based on my investigation, it does seem as though this would be considered a subsidiary unit and therefore out of scope. I am also not seeing evidence of affiliation usage at this level. 

There is another related unit in ROR (https://ror.org/038c0gc18) but it appears to be more independent (separate website) and I am seeing affiliation usage for it so I do not recommend deactivation of this record.

Description of change: The URL on this ror is a dead link.  If you check 2016 versions of the domain WayBackMachine you can see it is renamed as Gupta Family Foundation: https://web.archive.org/web/20161106132551/apexfoundation.org/

adambuttrick
02/03/2023, 18:44:43 | 02/03/2023, 18:50:50
comment_text: Chinese pharmaceutical company and [wholly-owned subsidiary](https://www.chipscreen.com/en/news/company-news/1088.html) of organization requested in https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/issues/2193. I can find a single instance of affiliation usage (https://doi.org/10.3389/fendo.2023.11096150). Publication link provided in the request does not resolve. [Contact page](https://www.chipscreen.com/en/contact?#contact-1) lists two divisions - Shenzhen Chipscreen Pharmaceutical and Chengdu Chipscreen Pharmaceutical as comprising https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/issues/2193, so I'm wondering if that is not the correct top-level entity to which this should roll up. That being said, we support these corporate hierarchies in many other records.

---
mariagould
02/24/2023, 22:25:15 | 02/24/2023, 22:25:15
comment_text: Given it is a wholly owned subsidiary, has the exact same URL as the entity in #2193, and we can only identify one instance of affiliation usage, I would not consider this to be a distinct entity and therefore recommend we roll up to the top-level entity.

02/21/2023, 15:46:38 | 02/21/2023, 15:46:38
comment_text: Chinese state enterprise that services the country's grid infrastructure. Funds and employs researchers. Solid affiliation usage. Should be added.

Publication affiliation usage: https://doi.org/10.1109/tasc.2018.2799544; https://doi.org/10.1109/access.2018.2847463; https://doi.org/10.1109/tpwrd.2019.2955726; https://doi.org/10.1109/tcpmt.2017.2677524; https://doi.org/10.1109/isgt-asia.2018.8467790; https://doi.org/10.1109/tasc.2020.2969386; https://doi.org/10.1109/tasc.2020.2970628

ORCID affiliation usage: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5156-340X

---
mariagould
02/25/2023, 21:36:41 | 02/25/2023, 21:36:41
comment_text: Based on what I can determine from [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China_Southern_Power_Grid), this is a subsidiary of China Southern Power Grid, which is already represented in ROR (https://ror.org/03hkh9419). It does not look like the other subsidiaries have separate ROR records. Most of the affiliation usage referenced above does seem to reflect China Southern Power Grid as the parent entity, e.g., in [10.1109/ISGT-Asia.2018.8467790](https://doi.org/10.1109/ISGT-Asia.2018.8467790). 

I think if we're going to create a new record for Guangzhou Power Supply Company, we should consider creating records for all of the related subsidiaries. For now, I think my recommendation would be to use the ROR ID for the parent entity.

I'll close the request for now but we can re-open and reconsider as needed.

comments:
adambuttrick
02/21/2023, 18:54:04 | 02/21/2023, 18:54:37
comment_text: Nuclear research institute at https://ror.org/021036w13. Affiliation usage is solid, but similar case to https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/issues/1933, where the research institute is not discreet from its university parent. That being said, appears to also function in a quasi-state capacity on nuclear research and security, so this may be okay to add. From the [organization's website:](http://www.inp.bsu.by/institut) "Provid[es] scientific and technical support to the Ministry of Emergency Situations in the field of nuclear and radiation safety."

@arthurpsmith Can you take a look?

Publication affiliation usage: https://doi.org/10.1038/srep07191; https://doi.org/10.1103/physrevb.73.195416; https://doi.org/10.1103/physrevb.81.205423; https://doi.org/10.1016/s0168-9002(02)00916-6; https://doi.org/10.1016/j.nima.2010.06.248

---
arthurpsmith
02/28/2023, 15:39:15 | 02/28/2023, 15:39:15
comment_text: Hmm, it seems to be *usually* stated as part of the university, but occasionally in the affiliation listings the university is not listed. The Soviet Union created a lot of institutes like this but generally they were established as part of an academy of sciences, and I'm not seeing that association in this case (which I would consider automatically making it eligible for ROR).

One place that I would look to whether this is considered an independent institution is INSPIRE-HEP - it is listed separately there: https://inspirehep.net/institutions/906240 - whereas there does NOT seem to be an independent listing there for the "Gleb Wataghin" institute in Brazil - it's included under Campinas State U - https://inspirehep.net/institutions/902714. But I wouldn't consider that a definitive rule, the INSPIRE-HEP listings are a bit idiosyncratic and may have some historical bias.

All that said, I'm slightly more inclined to add this to ROR than the Brazilian one, but I think it would be fine to consider both to simply be subsidiaries of their universities and not eligible.

---
adambuttrick
03/07/2023, 16:54:13 | 03/07/2023, 16:54:13
comment_text: Declining for now. INSPIRE-HEP already points at parent org, so appropriate references level seems to be sorted.

01/20/2023, 20:56:37 | 01/20/2023, 20:56:37
comment_text: Hmm, I thought we'd handled these sort of university institutes generally as part of the university and not eligible for ROR. The curation policy document says "Add to ROR if: publishing & using that affiliation, have separate funding source(s), dedicated staff, and have standalone (separate from university) website and branding." 
Yes, they have a good history of publishing and using that affiliation (but always along with UNICAMP). I don't see separate funding sources, and their staff all appear to be at the university, not associated with the institute independent of the university. The website domain is under unicamp.br and UNICAMP is mentioned on their web pages. Adding this might be a good idea, but I think adding it also opens up a lot of similar entities that we might not want to tackle...

adambuttrick
02/28/2023, 19:02:18 | 02/28/2023, 19:12:16
comment_text: While there is affiliation usage using this form, I'm having a hard time discerning whether this is a college of https://ror.org/02bzfxf13 or a distinct organization. Website, link to publications, and Amharic name in the request contained junk data in the original form of the request. I can find no other website for the organization. [Secondary references](https://iphce.org/acadp_listings/debre-tabor-university-college-of-medicine-and-health-science/) also seem to suggest this is a department. Recommend declining unless concrete evidence of this as distinct organization can be demonstrated.

Publication affiliation usage: https://doi.org/10.1186/s13104-018-3928-y; https://doi.org/10.1186/s13104-015-1056-5; https://doi.org/10.2147/cmar.s259849; https://doi.org/10.1186/s13104-019-4230-3; https://doi.org/10.11604/pamj.2021.38.211.22470; https://doi.org/10.1186/s12879-019-4695-7; https://doi.org/10.2147/hiv.s84341; https://doi.org/10.1186/s13104-019-4214-3; https://doi.org/10.1155/2019/8109898; https://doi.org/10.1155/2013/308204

ORCID affiliation usage: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-3673-9451 ; https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7166-7457 ; https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1776-9572

---
ssmulyan
03/25/2023, 00:18:13 | 03/25/2023, 00:18:13
comment_text: There is no distinction in branding, and I couldn't find any separate funding sources.   The college of health science is listed among several other colleges (natural science, business and economics, etc.).  They make a distinction between colleges, schools, and departments, but those all seem like subdivisions, not distinct institutions.  I think it is out of scope, and declining is appropriate, unless some other evidence is forthcoming.

comment_text: https://ror.org/01w3xx622 appears to have its [own site](http://www.ljgxb.com), which is separate from what was provided in the request. I unfortunately can't get the link in this request to load to compare. Full name in Chinese appears to be 兰州军区总医院, which also differs from the provided. That being said, [Wikipedia page](https://zh.wikipedia.org/zh-hans/%E4%B8%AD%E5%9B%BD%E4%BA%BA%E6%B0%91%E8%A7%A3%E6%94%BE%E5%86%9B%E8%81%94%E5%8B%A4%E4%BF%9D%E9%9A%9C%E9%83%A8%E9%98%9F%E7%AC%AC%E4%B9%9D%E5%9B%9B%E3%80%87%E5%8C%BB%E9%99%A2) for 940th hospital references this form as a former name, which leads me to believe they are the same or in some way related.

---
arthurpsmith
03/31/2023, 20:28:44 | 03/31/2023, 20:28:44
comment_text: It looks to me like they are the same thing also, at least based on the Chinese Wikipedia page which echoes much of what's on the "Hospital overview" page here: http://www.ljgxb.com/yygk/ - I think without further evidence we should treat this as one that's already in ROR but add a new or alternate name. But maybe we can contact the person making the original request and see if they have any more info?

title:
Split an existing ROR record into two or more records: 
 
Parks Canada008sy4716
body:
Summary of request: Split an existing ROR record into two or more records

Merge/split/deprecate records:
Organizations affected by this change:Parks Canada
ROR ID(s) of organization(s) affected by this change: 008sy4716
How should the record(s) be changed? The organization is broken into several "field units".  I do work for the organization, but not the centralized one in Ottawa (whose ID is noted above).
comments:
adambuttrick
04/17/2023, 16:13:34 | 04/17/2023, 16:13:55
comment_text: From Parks Canada [documentation](http://parkscanadahistory.com/publications/plans-priorities/1999-2000e.pdf), they do appear to have several field units which, "...are groupings of national parks, national historic sites, historic canals and national marine conservation areas that are in relatively close geographic proximity such that they can share certain management and administrative resources." That being said, were we to add these, they would be as child entities vs splitting this record. I will email requestor to clarify.
